course_title: Special Topics: Human Health: Writing Bodies
class_notes: This class studies the relationship between embodiment and writing: the way our bodies shape how we write and how to tell effective stories about the body. You will study several fictional masterpieces about various embodied states: chronic illness, dying, addiction, pregnancy, disability, deformity, aging, pain, etc.  Each student is then expected to write their own fictional narrative which we will workshop together in class. (Permission Only; reach out to Ms. Shiyra Addy in Human Health to apply)
course_description: Seminar of lecture series of topics in human health. May be repeated for credit when topic varies. Credit varies from one to five hours.
sections: Class Nbr: 2587, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 2:30-3:45p, Instructor: C. Eagle, Status: Open
